alert.note: Alert for Iron; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 16 at 3:27PM MST until January 16 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... North central Washington County in southwestern Utah... Central Iron County in southern Utah... * Until 415 PM MST * At 326 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 12 miles northwest of Dameron Valley, or 13 miles east of Beaver Dam, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Utah Route 18 between mile markers 28 and 51. Utah Route 56 between mile markers 23 and 57. Locations impacted include... Cedar City, Enterprise, Pinto and Newcastle. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
